adrFormatAddress: 259 1st Ave., New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: Came here for my flu shot and had such an easy, comfortable experience. It only took about 5 minutes and the staff were all soo kind and caring! It was only a minute off the L station so it was really easy to go to in between classes at NYU. Also, their coffee machine is really good!

text.text: Came here for my flu shot and had such an easy, comfortable experience. It only took about 5 minutes and the staff were all soo kind and caring! It was only a minute off the L station so it was really easy to go to in between classes at NYU. Also, their coffee machine is really good!

originalText.text: I waited over an hour, they have a camera on the whole time to do some virtual check in, with a virtual nurse on an extreme lag. Cleanliness seems to be an issue, I had to ask the nurse to change her gloves after touching the garbage bin, which has to be physically lifted with their hand to dispose of anything. I will be going back to 14th street urgent care.

text.text: I waited over an hour, they have a camera on the whole time to do some virtual check in, with a virtual nurse on an extreme lag. Cleanliness seems to be an issue, I had to ask the nurse to change her gloves after touching the garbage bin, which has to be physically lifted with their hand to dispose of anything. I will be going back to 14th street urgent care.

originalText.text: If I can leave a Zero I would. Tested positive for Strep they said they send the prescription and pharmacy never received the order. The number is automated by the time someone got back to me the pharmacy was closed. Spent a whole night without starting my medication and in pain. Next day spent all morning back and forth messaging with someone who texted me back and still he couldn’t help me. He is waiting for someone from prescription department to get back to him it’s been 2 hours still no meds. I bet if I did not have my $40 copay I would not be seen. Please go to another urgent care this place was my worst experience ever!

originalText.text:
Chaotic + over-scheduled but friendly staff.

Cons: their scheduling system was very dysfunctional! I needed to get stitches removed, and they called me day-off to reschedule because apparently there was no doctor on staff who could do it - strange! And then when I showed up for the new appt the next day, they told me the doctor on call didn’t show up due to an emergency. They rescheduled me again for a different location later that morning, and when I arrived they informed me I’d have to wait another 30 mins to an hour to be seen. Very frustrating!

Pros: the staff were very friendly and understanding, even though they really couldn’t do anything to fix the situation. They also waived my co-pay due to all the issues. They did a good, quick job removing the stitches once I was in.

My message to Nao - Get organized! Fix your chaos! You’re leaving a lot of people hanging. Thankfully I had a flexible schedule but if I didn’t would have been a real problem.

originalText.text:
This must be the worst urgent care i’ve ever been to. Went there on Wednesday and i was really sick, the dr joined virtually on Zoom (never heard of this before), then i specifically mentioned at least 3 times that i want my prescription to be sent to Walgreens on 1st Ave. the prescription was never sent and the urgent care closed early so i couldn’t go back.
I was really sick that on Thursday i couldn’t go to check on my prescription. I called and had to go from one automated voice to another with no luck. My friend ended up going in person because i couldn’t leave the house and they’re like “oh sorry we sent the prescription to CVS not Walgreen”.
Anyways, i remained sick, i booked an appointment again for 9 am on Friday, went there at 9 and they’re like you gotta wait because the PA is not here yet. I waited around 30 mins for them to come back and say that there is no one coming and they have to close the urgent care. Healthcare in this country has become a joke!
